name: Beginner Body Restoration
description: An 8-week corrective exercise program by Conor Harris focused on improving posture, gait cycle, and body mechanics. 4 phases of progressive exercises done daily.
programDetails:
## Program Overview
Watch the overview video for instructions on how to use the program most efficiently, common mistakes, and tips for maximizing progress.
https://youtu.be/wq0HsRcLl28

## Understanding the "Why"
A huge component of the exercises is "education" of the brain, rather than "mindless" corrective exercises. Intention matters.
https://youtu.be/kd-Ram-Y6gc

## How to Breathe
Breathing is foundational to this program. Exhale slowly through mouth, inhale fully through nose. The longer and more relaxed, the better.
https://youtu.be/bt6amVTDuxs

If you are struggling to get a full exhale, try using a balloon or straw in a short-seated position:
https://youtu.be/7zycDnqkOcA

## Materials Needed
- Wall space
- A chair
- A foam roller
- A pillow (maybe two)
- Resistance band (Phase 4)
- Optional: wedges for foot drills

## Frequency
3-4 sessions per week minimum, daily is ideal. Complete at least 14 days of each phase before advancing. Do not skip weeks.

## Effort Level
Start at 3/10 effort, never go beyond 5/10. This is the biggest mistake people make. If you aren't seeing results, you're likely trying too hard.

## Exercise Order
Do exercises in the order presented. Complete all sets of one exercise before moving to the next. Each exercise opens up space for the next one.

## Asymmetrical Considerations
Every exercise is programmed for both sides. For those wanting asymmetrical work, determine your lateralization:
https://youtu.be/GYTsaqHgtRY

## Shoewear
Proper footwear matters for mobility. Wear shoes as often as possible, even during exercises:
https://youtu.be/GWihpCoeorQ

## Not Seeing Results?
Common reasons: exercises not performed properly, cervical/dental issues, or trying too hard. Watch this for guidance:
https://youtu.be/VhdDIZNlRGU

## Keys to Success
- Breathing (without engaging the neck)
- Not trying too hard (3/10 effort)
- Understanding WHY you are doing each exercise
- Daily consistency

phases.name: Phase 1: Foundation
phases.description: Build awareness and create space in hips. Focus on breathing and low effort. Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFq2zv7d_8BDgk987_f-zLZKe55iWJoQW

weeks.notes: Perform daily. Complete 14 days before advancing to Phase 2.

exercises.notes: Gently create space in hips for subsequent exercises. Keep effort at 3/10.
Releases tight lats, opens chest, improves shoulder position.
Improves pelvic control with hamstrings and abs. Decompresses low back.
Decompresses pelvis, opens space for internal rotation, improves gait.

phases.name: Phase 2: Integration
phases.description: Integrate foot, chest, and hip movements. Build on Phase 1 foundations. Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFq2zv7d_8BCoZQ6CoSumuvI-SGoJlhHP

weeks.notes: Perform daily. Complete 14 days before advancing to Phase 3.

exercises.notes: Improves foot connection to ground and hip mobility.
Opens front ribs, improves rounded shoulders and forward head posture.
Improves internal rotation of hip, opens back of pelvis.
Improves hip external rotation, coordinates foot arch and glute activation.

phases.name: Phase 3: Strengthening
phases.description: Add strength work for calves, hips, and lateral shifting. Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFq2zv7d_8BDt-FcKDBmcKoI9hUfFr-mK

weeks.notes: Perform daily. Complete 14 days before advancing to Phase 4.

exercises.notes: Strengthens foot arch, improves end-range hip extension for better gait.

exercises.exerciseRef: Front Foot Elevated Hinged Split Squat
exercises.notes: Strengthens posterior chain, improves hip shifting without low back taking over.
Develops ability to shift side-to-side. Favorite drill for lateral shifting.
Optional: Improves trunk rotation, decompresses ribcage & shoulders.
Strengthens foot arch, improves end-range hip extension for better gait.

phases.name: Phase 4: Advanced Integration
phases.description: Full-range shoulder work, dynamic hip hinging, and advanced lateral shifting. Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFq2zv7d_8BDDOz6UCu6CfIlCtkpPd2iR

exercises.notes: Improves entire arc of shoulder mobility with full range of motion.
Improves dynamic hip shifting and proper glute coordination.
Advanced progression. Master Phase 3 version before attempting. Do not rush.
